View.name: View

classMethods.name: subview
classMethods.summary: Add the given subview wired to an outlet with the given name
classMethods.description: Add the given subview wired to an outlet with the given name

arguments.name: view
arguments.description: DOM element or jQuery node subview

classMethods.name: text
classMethods.summary: Add a text node with the given text content
classMethods.description: Add a text node with the given text content

classMethods.name: tag
classMethods.summary: Add a new tag with the given name
classMethods.description: Add a new tag with the given name

arguments.name: tagName
arguments.description: {String} name of the tag like 'li', etc

classMethods.name: raw
classMethods.summary: Add new child DOM nodes from the given raw HTML string.
classMethods.description: Add new child DOM nodes from the given raw HTML string.

instanceMethods.name: command
instanceMethods.summary: Calls the given handler when commandName is triggered on the {View}.
instanceMethods.description:
Calls the given handler when commandName is triggered on the {View}.

This is enhanced version of jQuery's `::on` method. It listens for a custom
DOM event and adds metadata to the DOM to maintain a list of all commands.

arguments.name: commandName
arguments.description: A namespaced {String} describing the command, such as `find-and-replace:toggle`.

arguments.name: selector
arguments.description: An optional selector {String} to filter the descendants of the elements that trigger the event.

arguments.name: options
arguments.description: An optional options {Object} with an `data` key.

arguments.name: handler
arguments.description: A {Function} to execute when the command is triggered.

arguments.name: handler
arguments.description: A {Function} to execute when the eventName is triggered.

View.summary: View class that extends the jQuery prototype.
View.description:
View class that extends the jQuery prototype.

Extending classes must implement a `@content` method.

examples.description:
Each view instance will have all the methods from the jQuery prototype
available on it.
examples.code:
craft = new Spacecraft()
  craft.find('h1').text() # 'Spacecraft'
  craft.appendTo(document.body) # View is now a child of the <body> tag
examples.raw:
```coffee
  craft = new Spacecraft()
  craft.find('h1').text() # 'Spacecraft'
  craft.appendTo(document.body) # View is now a child of the <body> tag
```
